name: py-pillow

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
Pillow is a fork of the Python Imaging Library (PIL). It adds image
processing capabilities to your Python interpreter. This library
supports many file formats, and provides powerful image processing and
graphics capabilities.

dependencies.name: freetype
dependencies.description:
FreeType is a freely available software library to render fonts. It is
written in C, designed to be small, efficient, highly customizable, and
portable while capable of producing high-quality output (glyph images)
of most vector and bitmap font formats.

dependencies.name: jpeg
dependencies.description:
libjpeg-turbo is a fork of the original IJG libjpeg which uses SIMD to
accelerate baseline JPEG compression and decompression. libjpeg is a
library that implements JPEG image encoding, decoding and transcoding.

dependencies.name: lcms
dependencies.description:
Little cms is a color management library. Implements fast transforms
between ICC profiles. It is focused on speed, and is portable across
several platforms (MIT license).

dependencies.name: libimagequant
dependencies.description:
Small, portable C library for high-quality conversion of RGBA images to
8-bit indexed-color (palette) images.

dependencies.name: libraqm
dependencies.description: Raqm provides a convenient API for the logic of complex text layout.

dependencies.name: libtiff
dependencies.description: LibTIFF - Tag Image File Format (TIFF) Library and Utilities.

dependencies.name: libwebp
dependencies.description:
WebP is a modern image format that provides superior lossless and lossy
compression for images on the web. Using WebP, webmasters and web
developers can create smaller, richer images that make the web faster.

dependencies.name: libxcb
dependencies.description:
The X protocol C-language Binding (XCB) is a replacement for Xlib
featuring a small footprint, latency hiding, direct access to the
protocol, improved threading support, and extensibility.

dependencies.name: openjpeg
dependencies.description:
OpenJPEG is an open-source JPEG 2000 codec written in C language. It has
been developed in order to promote the use of JPEG 2000, a still-image
compression standard from the Joint Photographic Experts Group (JPEG).
Since April 2015, it is officially recognized by ISO/IEC and ITU-T as a
JPEG 2000 Reference Software.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: zlib-api
dependencies.description: zlib replacement with optimizations for next generation systems.

dependent_to.name: py-torchgeo
dependent_to.description:
TorchGeo: datasets, samplers, transforms, and pre-trained models for
geospatial data.

dependent_to.name: py-ocp-models
dependent_to.description:
Reference implementation for the MLPerf HPC OpenCatalyst DimeNet++
benchmark

dependent_to.name: py-cairosvg
dependent_to.description:
CairoSVG is an SVG converter based on Cairo. It can export SVG files to
PDF, EPS, PS, and PNG files.

dependent_to.name: py-pytecplot
dependent_to.description:
The pytecplot library is a high level API that connects your Python
script to the power of the Tecplot 360 visualization engine. It offers
line plotting, 2D and 3D surface plots in a variety of formats, and 3D
volumetric visualization. Familiarity with Tecplot 360 and the Tecplot
360 macro language is helpful, but not required.

dependent_to.name: topaz
dependent_to.description:
topaz: Pipeline for particle picking in cryo-electron microscopy images
using convolutional neural networks trained from positive and unlabeled
examples. Also featuring micrograph and tomogram denoising with DNNs.

dependent_to.name: mlperf-deepcam
dependent_to.description:
PyTorch implementation for the climate segmentation benchmark, based on
the Exascale Deep Learning for Climate Analytics

dependent_to.name: py-gooey
dependent_to.description:
Turn (almost) any command line program into a full GUI application with
one line
